article.headline: Western Michigan 68, Ball State 59
article.story: KALAMAZOO, Mich. (AP) -- Joe Reitz scored 20 points, leading four Western Michigan players in double figures, and the Broncos defeated Ball State 68-59 in a Mid-American Conference game Thursday night. Reitz also had a game-high 10 rebounds for Western Michigan (7-11, 4-4), which won its third straight game. Reitz hit 7-of-10 shots and converted 6-of-7 free throws. Derek Drews scored a career-high 14 points off the bench for Western Michigan, while Andrew Hershberger had 12 and Stane's Bufford added 10. Maurice Acker led Ball State (6-10, 2-6) with 15 points as the Cardinals lost on the road for the sixth straight time. Western Michigan held Ball State forward Skip Mills to 9 points, breaking Mills' string of 23 consecutive games scoring in double figures that dated back to February 2005. Ball State trailed by just one point with 5:11 left, but hit just two baskets the remainder of the game -- both in the final 44 seconds of play after Western had pulled ahead by more than 10 points.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
